choices.text: Uncuffed tube; size choosen according to age
Nasopharyngeal airway; measuring from tip of nose to ear lobule
Oropharyngeal airway; measuring from angle of mouth to angle of mandible

questions.text: A 72-year-old male posted for a noncardiac surgery. He is a diagnosed case of moderate mitral stenosis and mild mitral regurgitation. It is required to do induction with a cardiovascular stable anaesthetic agent. All are true about intravenous anaesthetic agent and cardiovascular system

A 45 yrs old was brought to emergency with high fever and respiratory distress and altered conciousness. Patient was put on IV antibiotic and intubated. Half an hour after intubation his saturation dropped to 88% from 95%, capnography reading changed from 39 mm of Hg to 54 mm of Hg, airway pressure increased and following change was noticed in capnography reading. On auscultation there was bilateral decrease in air entry
A 48yrs old ASA grade 2 patient was being operated for laparoscopic cholecystectomy. All of the following monitor should be attached during intraoperative period except
Which safety system of machine prevents incorrect attachment of following

choices.text: To provide nutrition for the spinal cord cells

questions.text: A 24-year-old G2P0A1 female is admitted to the labor room for delivery. Since there is cephalo-pelvic disproportion, she is being planned for an emergency cesarean section under spinal anesthesia. She is kept in the left lateral position, and the anesthetist prepares to administer the anesthetic agent. He asks specifically for bupivacaine anesthetic containing dextrose as an additive. For what reason would this be necessary?

A 5-year-old male twin presents with acute appendicitis. He is scheduled for an emergent appendectomy. His family history is significant for his twin brother suffering a malignant hyperthermia episode that led to a 2-week intensive care unit stay, but eventual recovery with treatment. Which of the following anesthetic drugs should be avoided in this patient?

A 57- year-old female is posted for laparoscopic cholecystectomy. She had a medical background of Type 2 diabetes, with a HbA1c of 8%. She also has a history of heart problems and is dyspneic while doing normal household work and even at rest. She belongs to ASA grade

A 43-year-old patient underwent an emergency minor arm repair procedure after a car accident. A standard dose of lidocaine was administered near the brachial plexus for peripheral nerve block. All of the following adverse effects can likely occur after the administration except?

A 36-year-old woman is receiving general anaesthesia for a diagnostic laparoscopy in the Trendelenburg position with carbon dioxide insufflation. During a 15-minute period after induction, her SpO2 decreases from 99% to 90% and PETCO2 increases from 38 to 13 mmHg. FiO2 is 0.3; all ventilator settings have been constant. Which of the following is the most likely cause of these changes?

choices.text: Unconsciousness with pulse and breathing absent
Unconsciousness with pulse present and breathing absent
Unconsciousness with pulse and breathing present
Unconsciousness with pulse absent and breathing present

choices.text: Put the pt. in left lateral position

questions.text: An unresponsive patient in ambulance on attachment of monitors showed following rhythm. What should be done immediately

choices.text: Start halothane to decrease the heart rate
